qVE4FruB3UajGjczYJTA-A.text: This review was for their evening sitting so maybe more fool me for not coming for breakfast/brunch.The service was nice but the food was terrible. A "brisket" roll was a grey slab of tough beef. The carbonara was thick and gloopy. The red wine suggested at £25 was terrible. Sadly I think you should stick to the breakfast which does get excellent reviews! Swerve the dinner.

yXykjUJ0mbMN2xjElfVE1g.text: I love this place!! It's so cute and the pancakes are BOMB. I wish I could eat them every day but I'll settle for once a week. Gonna bring visitors here for for sure. The avocado toast is also delish.

8ToTwrOQzOQ-upgzM566hQ.text: This is a new venture from Soho House. But unlike anything else associated with Soho House , this restaurant in the classy place of Notting Hill West London is very understated. Previously an Asian eaterie, it even has the exterior name of Thai Break crossed out to now Egg Break.What I liked was the fantastic service inside. And they of course did egg dishes very well. I liked the buns with egg and chicken and pork belly best though there were other surprising delights along the way. Even the cocktails were very good. Quite out of the way for me but if I'm in area I will be back for sure.

9iQ_6_z03BsAK3z1se6gqA.text: My love for eggs is not new. I've always loved eggs, all kind of them. So if you fancy some really good eggs yourself, I suggest that you hurry up to egg break because this place is totally cracking ! YUMMYYou have the basics, with avocado, florentine, benedicte, royale, english. Or you can go extra with super softy bun. My heart really hesitated between the fried chicken egg buns and the pork belly fried egg siracha bun.Get yourself some house press to go with your egg. The green house press is my favorite because green goes well with yellow (kale, apple, cucumber, celery and tons of other green stuff). MONEY MONEY MONEYYou won't break your wallet here. Your eggs/buns will cost you less than £10Your house press £4 for small or £7 for a largeWHAT I LIKE - They serve salads, soup, other plates and other if you're not feeling like havings eggs. But keep in mind that the place is called EGG BREAK !- Really cute presentation. - Coffee and dessert are pretty goodHOW TO GO WITH? Your girlfriends for brunch

_-bsKOB6ghHJ28zngNasmw.text: Great food and location, cute place. Service though, is seriously lacking. Took 15 minutes to get my check and another 10 to get my change (which they first assumed was an additional 30% tip) while the one server was on the phone trying to get the credit card machine fixed.

GKaPV1a53YKVrdqNGvwnfw.text: Egg Break is an adorably quirky little cafe hidden down a little side street near Notting Hill Gate. The space was previously inhabited by a Thai restaurant so they have simply crossed out the word "Thai" on the signage and replaced it with "Egg". This is a perfect example of the laid back, quirky but cute atmosphere you will find. Upon first entering the restaurant seems tiny however after going down stairs and winding around tiny hallways you are welcomed by a slightly larger dining space. The tables are squished together in a slightly disorganized manner but this only adds to the charm. The menu is short and sweet featuring a variety of dishes featuring (as you probably guessed) eggs! The service was a bit slow but once the food came it was delicious. The avocado toast was beautifully presented and the poached eggs revealed yolks that were insanely yellow and amazing. I will certainly come back to try some of their other brunch dishes and possibly their dinner options as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Break - London, United Kingdom. avocado toast!

WcjKePQvMhP8fxGT0tVFGQ.text: Hot spot for bloggers and foodies. I've traveled the world and love finding a place with avo toast.... This one is 4/5 in my book! Try the Mexican egg dish bursting with flavor....almond milk cappys were great too. Nice spot to stop if you are in the area. Cute interior, great place to work and enjoy company as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Break - London, United Kingdom. The bread is amazing... Add eggs for perfection
Photo of Egg Break - London, United Kingdom. Mexican egg dish... I loved
Photo of Egg Break - London, United Kingdom. Avo toast

Pno-dcM7Z6LgfAuTNkTc6Q.text: Great food, fab prices and a good location! Would definitely go back! Had the avocado toast. Was amazing! So many other things I'd like to try

82dqE1k_I6FtTf9Zbdnyvg.text: Loved it here place is very small...but I was lucky it wasn't packed and did not have to wait breakfast was amazing everything I had tasted great recommend to everyone... Service was good too fast and clean

385S_EJ7UneBpL_94hx_WA.text: This morning I had very delicious breakfast in egg break. My order was cornbread with pouched egg and it was amazing. My sisters ordered sashed avocado and the Mahican egg and were amazing also. I'm visiting London for 10 days and I'll defiantly going to visit egg break again before going back

FNywuM5seSaZVlKOvbK3sg.text: friendly staffthere is usually  a queue for breakfast but reasonable waiting time (15-20 mins)I tried the corn fritters with poached eggs, it was fantastictheir pancakes are tasty

varqG6ayYTaO4Feg9yiKmQ.text: Egg Break was my introduction to the London brunch scene, and what an introduction it was. It is a pretty standard café that actually reminded me a lot of Two Hands in NYC, in that it's a pretty, instagrammable space dedicated to over-charging willing participants in the act of brunch.I ordered the avo toast, because I am a basic white female with a penchant for basic white female brunch foods. Little did I know, the toast also came with poached eggs on top, which were perhaps the best part of the meal. I can barely cook scrambled eggs for myself, so a runny yolk that won't make me visibly ill is a welcome change. I also had the green juice, as the menu didn't mention their coffee at all, and it was a great complement to my eggs.Though the food and atmosphere were equally impressive, I ultimately left frustrated because of the scattered service. It took quite a while to get our food, and even longer to get the check. Other reviews have said that Egg Break is under new management, though, so I'll be a little forgiving. Hopefully, this will work itself out, and the experience will be of equal quality to the food itself.

VUNzyYYCe2zp9dot3ALl-g.text: Great French toast, quality coffee and tea. The sauces here are also fantastic and average price breakfast for the area

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Break - London, United Kingdom. High quality coffee and tea

bqAXHbemj3VSS5v09YXilg.text: After all these brunch places I tried in London, I thought I would be tired of eating eggs, waffles and stuff... But yeah, who am I kidding, brunch is awesome ! I saw so many pictures about Eggbreak on Instagram, that on my weekend back in London I decided to have breakfast there with my roommate. We knew we would have to queue (especially since it's in Notting Hill) but surprisingly enough, we only had to wait for about 10 minutes, which is not so bad.Surely it's because they have many tables available, on different levels. We ate at a small table at the lower level (with no windows). Sure, you can't enjoy the daylight, but the decoration makes up for it (and the food as well).I had the cornbread waffles with bacon and eggs, ordered a rose green tea, while my roommate had avocado on toast (a fancier version of course). The food was delicious, so so tasty and I really liked it, but I was surprised to be really into the green tea !Most of the time, I'm all about the food, but I have to admit the tea added a really nice touch to this brunch.I would definetely recommend this place, but maybe try to be there early to grab a table near a window ?

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Break - London, United Kingdom. Egg & avocado on toast, cornbread waffles with bacon & eggs

TLSOJ9lX8ATDOzRA6koJoQ.text: It is cute place w reasonable price. Someone would like to try trendy and no. Traditional flavor breakfast such as lots of middle eastern enhanced brf  menu would work. I tried quinoa porridge, it was very grainy that hard to swallow. It is not actually porridge.  Who in love w quinoa, I recommend it.

JsAjp0J7Zo_vWEbESxFqOw.text: We went as part of their soft launch so hopefully they will improve over time. The service was friendly but exceptionally slow. We waited ages for our coffees and while the people are super nice, they didn't tell us that something we ordered wasn't on the menu till they served us and gave us an alternative without telling us. The coffee is decent but all of our food was luke warm. I personally wouldn't come back as the breakfast really wasn't that great. My friend had the waffles which were super dry and my pancakes were pretty naff. I must say though, there was a decent amount of fruit with the pancakes though and the berries were very plump! It looks pretty and they have all the calling cards of 'trendy brunch' with their acme mugs and decorative plates but when it comes down to substance the food just isn't up to scratch. I wouldn't go again and wouldn't recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Break - London, United Kingdom. Fruit pancakes and a latte with a side of bacon.

-VYHWTLP5-E_sn2zfg5TMg.text: Egg break is recently had a change in management and therefore a new brunch menu was introduced. Missed out on their old menu and sad to never got to try their their hotdog kimchi rice I was still quite eggcited to see what they got on offer being a big lover of breakfast dishes.Their restaurant was more like a cafe, quaint and homely with their long stretch of cushioned seating downstairs accompanied with individual cushions too. Nice house old plants to add some nice natural green to the place against the white tables and walls. They really made used of their place to fit as many tables as possible which made the place quite cramp at times, during the weekends. House stuffed flatbread We fancied something quick to snack on whilst our mehad a very satisfying texture being doughy and chewy. The filling of spinach, feta, cucumber, yogurt and sumac brought in very light healthy flavours as well as adding a lovely contrast in texturesCornbread waffles These were delicious. I loved the how the waffles were already sweetened so we didn't have to drizzle it with syrup. I find it by doing it that way the sweetness is more even across the dish. They were nice and firm yet slightly spongy inside. The bacon was grilled so the edges were crisp, adding a nice contrast of saltiness. Topped nicely with a rich organic free range sunny side up and drizzled with a bit of ketchup to a nice vinegary sweetness.Corn cakes These were my favourite dish of the meal. Presented like eggs florentine it made me realise what a difference it makes to have a different base and something that holds more flavour. They were bouncy, lovely flavours from added vegetables creating lovely textures and flavours. The burst of sweetness from the corn was felt against the velvety spinach and the lovely rich poached eggs. Hollandaise was perfect and creamy wrapping everything up nicelyBacon cheeseburger doubled up Fantastic burger. Shows the drastic improvements of what high quality ingredients can do to a burger. No need for extra garnishes as the medium rare patty was so packed with flavour, sweetness and incredibly meaty and tender. It was as juicy as a good steak! Cheese was rich and creamy and for once I could actually taste it in every bite of the burger. The pineapple bacon jam gave the whole burger a good zest and flavour and all topped nicely with a pillow soft brioche bun. Chips were like McDonald's ones, thin, salty and tasty. The only thing I would question is the bacon in the name as it doesn't have any in it and was probably just preferring to the bacon jam itself.French toastAnd the amazing crunchy dessert. How they managed to achieve such a great contrast of a thin crispy crunchy top toast and a wet spongy inside? I really don't know. But it's amazing especially with a lovely addition of soft ripen bananas to add another type of sweetness to it and blueberries for a little burst of zest to balance it. Drizzled over with maple syrup to make it even more moist and tasty.I absolutely love Egg break. Just a shame that it is not one of those places you can just sit and relax at your own comfort without feeling remorse seeing those queuing up at the door eager to get a seat like you once were. At such a small cramp place, noise levels were pretty high too with music that is way too loud for a little place like this. At least service was fantastic, great at giving suggestions and looked like they were enjoying themselves too. It's always nice to have enthusiastic staff. Anyway I highly recommend this place nevertheless although be aware that the name 'Egg break' is deceiving as not all of their dishes contain egg although most do.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Break - London, United Kingdom. Staff behind the bar
Photo of Egg Break - London, United Kingdom. Interior
Photo of Egg Break - London, United Kingdom. Interior

CXwwj8cw12iO1fZbfvt8SQ.text: I like Eggbreak. I like the decor, the relaxed atmosphere, the food.. But I do feel there is room for improvement.I visited for Sunday brunch during the soft launch, during which food was 50% off. I had the smashed avocado on sourdough, with poached eggs. It was lovely - perfectly cooked eggs, not too mushy avocado and a good sized portion. The sourdough was a little on the hard side and it was slightly cold when served. I would order this again.My companion had the bacon cheeseburger which comes with fries. It was a good burger, nicely pink in the middle (it should be noted that the server didn't ask how he would prefer it to be cooked). I wouldn't really call this a bacon cheeseburger though as it has no rashers of bacon, instead the bacon is in the pineapple bacon jam, which still wasn't very bacony.What I wouldn't order again are the fresh fruit juices. They were nice enough, but £4 for the smallest glass of juice I've seen is too much.Service was friendly but slow, although the food was served promptly.I would recommend Eggbreak if you're nearby, but don't go out of your way for it.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Break - London, United Kingdom. Brunch menu
Photo of Egg Break - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Egg Break - London, United Kingdom. Bacon cheeseburger

LA2orAjvR2PhwtgBu0HO7w.text: Overall Score: 5Service/Ambiance Rating: 5Food Rating: 5Holy crap. I cannot believe this place only has 3.5 stars. I typically go off of reviews and don't eat anywhere 4 or more stars. I happened to go here with a friend and I loved every second of it. The music was great. The plating was great. Most important, the food was great. First five star review I've written; I wish I could try everything on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Break - London, United Kingdom. Banana and berries inside. Mmm
Photo of Egg Break - London, United Kingdom. Avocado

rQGDRXXb44L6GyZt8K0O3g.text: Went here for a late lunch, and it was the best decision I've made all week. I took forever to decide what to get because everything on the menu sounds delicious! I ended up getting the levantine eggs, which were fabulous--crispy, herby chickpeas and a perfect fried egg on top of freshly baked wheat toast. Plus bottomless drip coffee!! My friend got the sweet potato rosti, which she said was one of the best things she's ever eaten, and a rose latte. Service was friendly and attentive. I highly recommend Egg Break (and I will definitely be back).

ErISslOcdrmKVm1E38LqDg.text: This has quickly become my absolute favorite place to eat in London. As an American new to the country, I had been searching for somewhere that had breakfast without baked beans in it. From the moment I stepped into Eggbreak, I knew I'd found it. Not only is the food outstanding in every way (the French toast is the best I've ever had), but the vibe of the place is second to none. It's a cozy place, well-decorated, with great music and a wonderful atmosphere. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Now that I've found it, I don't think anything could keep me away.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Break - London, United Kingdom. The Crunchy French Toast, with bananas and blueberries in between the slices, is the best I've ever had

0yJdCwgQgWq4gyiJgmqruw.text: My first breakfast in London, and I'm blown away by this wonderful place tucked away behind a busy street. Our waitress, Elizabeth was as wonderful as the food in this delightful place. She provided written instructions for our afternoon of touring London and made us feel right at home. As for the food, the eggs are fabulous as is the pancakes and French toast. I highly recommend this place.

7u1TWesSDm4koL9sHerf4w.text: Ok - edit to above post. Pancakes are not gluten free.  I take a star down for the lack of knowledge of the waitress and improperly informing me that the pancakes were.

lrCbm3u-VgYuIU8Lp0vwfQ.text: Don't eat here, the waiters have attitude for no reason, and they don't know what syrup is, no matter how you pronounce it. Also the food was dry and chewy. SYRUP WOULD HAVE REMEDIED THIS. Atmosphere was nice tho, as were the glass bottles water was served in.

cJ1CRalmH16cO5q7pE6aug.text: This is an awesome little place. My husband had the mexican omelette and said it was delicious. The decor js simple yet elegant. Staff is helpful and friendly. A bit pricey on the drinks though.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Break - London, United Kingdom. Mexican Omelette

adLzDGORL70RZMNTcksX4Q.text: We came during the soft launch. The food was outstanding. I had the fried chicken sandwich which came with chilli sauce and pickled cabbage; it was amazing, one of the best things I've ever tasted. Service was a very pleasant too.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Break - London, United Kingdom. Fried chicken sandwich. Divine.

ZFwjyCyjmjRozjXktYpDqA.text: This place is a gem! I discovered it after visiting Portabello Market last Saturday (thanks to a quick Yelp search) and absolutely loved it. We loved it so much we went back again 2 days later right before flying back to the U.S. The food is so fresh & yummy, the space is so cozy & quaint, and the staff is lovely. There are lots of good breakfast spots in Los Angeles, but Egg Break beats them all. I will definitely return the next time I'm in London!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Break - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Egg Break - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Egg Break - London, United Kingdom

tG0SuJuWEOO0ca5ooagHuw.text: When there for their second launching which was highly expected by everyone. But it such a disappointment for us. The food quality is not even comparable to a random restaurant who not specifically do breakfast. Shakshuka which is highly recommended was dry, under seasoned. The portion was small. Food is on the cold side. I think Good business advertising strategy should come along with good food quality

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Break - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Egg Break - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Egg Break - London, United Kingdom

FnCb3R8bGwM4m5XvDAe4bA.text: Came here for the soft launch yesterday and had a pleasant brunch. Our server was helpful and friendly when describing what was on their new menu and recommended favorites and what plates to share.The decor is hipster and artsy, loved the cafe like vibes as well. As for the food, it is  pricey- around £9 for a sweet plate of pancakes or French toast, but the presentation is nice. The poached eggs on corn cakes were my favorite as their hollandaise is quite special from others I've tasted. The business uses sustainable sources for  their food, and is only a short walk from the tube stop.Overall a good food and day out experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Break - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Egg Break - London, United Kingdom

ey81OZy0G-wOQkzJM2HlfQ.text: Went to London for five days, ate here three mornings. Fresh eggs, fresh everything. Great staff, service, and decor. Highly recommend.

0OG3BmrgXnS3kKMJIKtxKw.text: Yum! This is an amazing brunch spot. Everything was great. I got the smashed avocado toast, which was delicious. Kids wanted to get fried chicken dishes, which I thought was strange but what a great choice! If I come back here another time, I will get the chicken and waffles. Their fried chicken is perfection.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Break - London, United Kingdom

ciHFBgaAiFaYyzcVuftKbQ.text: There was over a 30 min wait for brunch and once we were seated and ordered our dishes were served quickly. The food was worth the wait!Three dining rooms of what looks like an old home make up this restaurant. Space is limited but it's cosy with pillows on seats.A large menu with something for everyone. Healthy, indulgent, original and traditional dishes. I went with the fried chicken burger which had the right spice level, pickles and onions. The shoe string fries were tasty. My companion enjoyed her salt beef hash with eggs and bread. Satisfying.The original Bloody Mary was a bit boring. There was no lime or celery, barely any spice. Might need to go for something bolder next time, as they have 4 types to choose from along with coffee, tea, and other cocktails.Overall I enjoyed the meal and would definitely return for breakfast or lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Break - London, United Kingdom. Double the fun :) :)
Photo of Egg Break - London, United Kingdom. Lucky Peach salt beef hash and eggs
Photo of Egg Break - London, United Kingdom. Fried chicken burger

Qlsy24t8CzMZSzkyc2WJ2g.text: Just visiting London for a bit before traveling to Belgium and was looking for a place with some solid eggs benedict. I got the Crabcakes Benedict and it's probably the best I've ever had. Staff was very friendly and attentive. Definitely would recommend this place to anyone, local or just passing through.10/10

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Break - London, United Kingdom. Crabcakes Benedict

w2yREX-gmbGa30stOQd-fg.text: Fantastic service! Food was served quickly and our waitress was so kind and funny. Definitely recommend this place as a good breakfast spot to get your day going. I went during the week so it wasn't as crowded and we were able to get a table right away. I ordered the Eggs Benny with salmon which was delicious :)

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Break - London, United Kingdom

zTJIsD4WefA53KwkCaReZA.text: Amazing service such nice and outgoing servers! Food came nearly immediately even with a group of 8 people and tasted amazing. The music tops the place off! All 80's, love it. Wish I lived here to come here everyday!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Break - London, United Kingdom

CkXZsJbbBpZSd5BeH4g7MQ.text: We were looking to experience an afternoon English tea. Found this great place in Notting Hill Gate. Smashed avo w poached eggs on toast was delish!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Break - London, United Kingdom

hYvEOrL_TA8KklJRp-7C0w.text: Amazing food but u have to wait even they have empty tables  the food are delicious specially for vegetarians like me

xU50EqCfT41Log66z4Y4tg.text: Looks like a small quaint place on the outside, but they actually have lots of tables downstairs too. Had the red juice, americano and avocado toast. The juice was super refreshing and naturally sweet, which I liked. The americano was nicely prepared and served in the cutest cup. And let's talk about the avocado toast!!! The avocado to toast ratio was on point. Pretty sure there were two whole avocados on my toast. And it came with two poached eggs- nice portions! Friendly service too!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Break - London, United Kingdom

yNcVcUfZ68Ifq8EJcg-RUQ.text: Best breakfast we have had in London! Super cute and trendy. Got here around 10:30am and didn't have to wait more than 25 minutes. Highlights were the heaping avocado toast with poached eggs. The sweet potato dish was delicious...yummy complex flavors with kale, a yogurt sauce and delicious cheese.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Break - London, United Kingdom. Avocado toast and sweet potato egg dish
Photo of Egg Break - London, United Kingdom. French toast
Photo of Egg Break - London, United Kingdom

hBpwBc_a3CEJoi3hh_1OzQ.text: Place was delicious !  A little pricey but cute and quaint. Service was excellent as well. Probably one of the best breakfasts I have had in a really long time! I highly recommend it!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Break - London, United Kingdom

U_J8gsiHA5Q9M24FYVn8AQ.text: God bless this restaurant its one of the best places for breakfast ever.Amazing staff , we came 4 times and we almost tried all the menu Eggs, pancakes, French toast with caramelized banana and cornflakes Heaven!

dtlpaugQ7xdrfFGnuycvkw.text: A nice place for brunch! Food was not exceptional, but the ambiance and service made our meal very pleasant and enjoyable. I got the Eggs Benny with smoked salmon, and while the hollandaise was not bad, it didn't leave too much of an impression and the English muffin was too thick which made it hard to eat everything together. Eggs were done very well (as the name suggests), and this echoed for my friends Mexican Omelette as well which was delicious and flavourful. Would go again, but mindful that drink prices are a bit expensive.

-1MbO49Kx4CvCtBaTghheQ.text: Egg Break is what it looks like: a brunch café targeting youths with Instagram accounts who put avocado on everything (i.e. me).  The interior has a pleasant trendiness to it, the food is well plated, and ordering tea gets you milk in this really cute mini milk bottle.  The ground floor seating is just as nice, open, and airy as the first floor, so don't walk away just because there are no tables available upstairs.  The portion sizes are strangely varied (my chia pudding was tiny, but my friend's avocado toast was enormous).  My favorite thing I tried was the green juice; sharp and tangy, it pairs surprisingly well with breakfast.This is very clearly a new cafe, and the management still has some kinks to smooth out.  The food itself was decent enough, but the service seems a bit haphazard.  We were served (slowly) by three different waitresses in an hour.  The menu was also oddly incomplete; it says not a word about coffee and only after trying to order a specialty tea they were out of did I find out they serve regular Yorkshire tea.  I hope to come back in a few years time to find that the experience has reached the standard of the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Break - London, United Kingdom. Little baby chia pot and secret Yorkshire tea

lKMlCxa34a6QVw1cDBSG8w.text: Hands down the best breakfast I had in London during my week long trip.  Staff was awesome, food was delicious and the house coffee is bottomless!  If it looks really busy when you get there don't worry, there is seating downstairs too.

oXIeQ-q17cMGT_zJ5-wyeg.text: Great little spot for breakfast.  Initially a locals hideout but it changes vibe as the day goes on. (Had a breakfast one day and lunch another). Crab cake w siracha was fabulous!   Just the right amount of spicy.  Coffee was good but I wish they would have refilled it at least once.    Never happened - probably too busy.  Mostly a 5 star place but when the rock music started at 11 am -- I lost my appetite and the soft welcoming vibe was lost.  Recommend an early start -- becomes more touristy around lunch.

xIPEex7AH0e8OCl6HP47Bg.text: I found this place overrated and overpriced (5 pounds for a small glass of tea). I got one poached egg over a sweet potatoes bed and kale and for 10 pounds I expected at least 2 eggs. The french toast were too sweet and with no maple syrup. Would not recommend

uxHCE8VADHzbtfUTEuTiWw.text: Excellent food. Very hard to get a table but it's worth the wait. The staff were super friendly. Ordered a tipsy tea which was lovely, served in a teapot. The tables are very close to one another so it's very cosy and tight.

cUalmd6Fm8YlR_q75R8GgQ.text: Loved this place. My husband and I went to get a late breakfast. The Mexican and Turkish dishes were great. The Turkish dish had a bit too much dill and yogurt, but I think that's a matter of preference. We were skeptical about the pancakes because they have caramel on top, but the pancakes were so good! The waiters were attentive despite being very busy.

LLk1UrE_bf_QGL-QmZ4J-Q.text: The menu here was one of the hardest menus to decide from because EVERYTHING looks so good. I decided on the eggs benedict, and the rest of my table all ordered different things. Everything we got was phenomenal! This place has truly nailed the art of the poached egg. Also really vegetarian friendly, and the flavors were different than a generic brunch place which was nice.

gC6ZAUghHo5sWaKcfyV6EQ.text: EXCELLENT! EXCELLENT! EXCELLENT!!! Food was DELICIOUS!!!! Absolutely, delicious! If you're in the Notting Hill area, flood this place with your business. Order the French toast, Mexican omelette, and crab cake, fresh squeeze orange juice, and great coffee. Prepare to leave stuffed! Amazing place. I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Egg Break - London, United Kingdom. Mexican omelette. Awesome!
Photo of Egg Break - London, United Kingdom. French toast with caramelized bananas and blueberries! Amazing. Enough for 2 people if you're ordering something else!
Photo of Egg Break - London, United Kingdom. Crab cake with scrambled egg and hollandaise sauce with chili flakes.....INCREDIBLE!!!
